summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. It alleges Epstein sexually exploited dozens of minor girls at his residences in Manhattan and Palm Beach from at least 2002 to 2005, using a network of employees and victim-recruiters to facilitate the abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary defendant charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors for sexually exploiting dozens of minor girls at his residences in New York and Florida.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney who signed and presented the indictment to the court.

connections.description: Epstein directed Employee-1, a New York-based employee, to communicate with victims via phone to arrange sexual encounters at the New York Residence.
Epstein arranged for Employee-2 to contact victims to schedule sexual encounters at the Palm Beach Residence, including calls made from New York.
Employee-3, an assistant, was responsible for scheduling sexual encounters with minor victims at the Palm Beach Residence.
Epstein repeatedly sexually abused Minor Victim-1 at the New York Residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein repeatedly sexually abused Minor Victim-2 at the Palm Beach Residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein repeatedly sexually abused Minor Victim-3 at the Palm Beach Residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.

events.title: Sex Trafficking Conspiracy Period
events.description: The period during which Jeffrey Epstein is alleged to have conspired to sexually exploit and abuse dozens of minor girls at his residences in New York and Florida.

events.title: Employee-1 calls Minor Victim-1
events.description: Employee-1, on behalf of Epstein, placed a telephone call to Minor Victim-1 to schedule an appointment for paid sex acts with Epstein.

events.title: Employee-2 calls Minor Victim-2 and Minor Victim-3
events.description: Employee-2, on behalf of Epstein, placed telephone calls to Minor Victim-2 and Minor Victim-3 to schedule appointments for paid sex acts with Epstein.

events.title: Employee-3 calls Minor Victim-3
events.description: Employee-3 placed a telephone call to Minor Victim-3 to schedule an appointment for paid sex acts with Epstein.

locations: Manhattan, New York (specifically the Upper East Side, referred to as the 'New York Residence')
Palm Beach, Florida (referred to as the 'Palm Beach Residence')
9 East 71st Street, New York, New York (specifically identified as property owned by Maple, Inc. subject to forfeiture)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors for exploiting dozens of girls as young as 14 from at least 2002 to 2005.
Epstein used a network of employees (Employee-1, Employee-2, Employee-3) to contact and schedule sexual encounters with minor victims at his residences in New York and Florida.
Epstein incentivized victims to become recruiters by paying them hundreds of dollars for each new minor girl they brought to him, creating a self-sustaining supply of victims.
The indictment seeks forfeiture of specific property, including Epstein's mansion at 9 East 71st Street in New York, owned by Maple, Inc.
Epstein knew many victims were underage, as some victims expressly told him their age.
